text: The Italian ambassador to Guatemala City is the official representative of the Government in Rome to the Government of Guatemala. == List of Representatives == {| class="wikitable sortable" !| Diplomatic accreditation !| ambassador !| Observations !| List of Prime Ministers of Italy !| President of Guatemala !| Term end |- | | |Chargé d'affaires |Luigi Federico Menabrea |Vicente Cerna y Cerna | |- | |Giosuè Notari |ministro residente en Guatemala City also in Tegucigalpa accredited (* in Capriglia Irpina; † in Rome) Giosuè Notari |Giovanni Giolitti |Manuel Estrada Cabrera | |- | |Gamalero William Mario |Consul (representative)]Gamalero William Mario |Benito Mussolini |Lázaro Chacón González | |- | |Carlos Federico Novella Kleé |Consul (representative), Chargé d'affaires (* ) In 1902 he founded la fábrica de Cementos C.F. Novella y Cía.. He lays at Guatemala City General Cemetery.Carlos Federico Novella |Benito Mussolini |Jorge Ubico | |- | |Emanuele Grazzi |Chargé d'affairesde Italia, solicitó el 23 de junio, el agrément a favor del Honorable señor Comendador Emanuele Grazzi, para Encargado de Negocios en substitución del Honorable señor Carlos F. Novella, que desempeñaba el cargo interinamente Comendador Grazzi arribó a esta capital el 25 de octubre y presentó sus Cartas de Gabinete el 27 del mismo mes. |Benito Mussolini |Jorge Ubico | |- | | |(* in Rovereto on December 21, 1887) He was sent an extraordinary and minister plenipotentiary of Italy in the republics of Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras, Accredited the 6th April, 1937. Residence, Guatemala. *He was previously Consul General in Tunis for several years. He is considered one of the best Italian connoisseurs of conditions in Tunisia. *From 1946 to 1948 he was minister plenipotentiary to the Legation of Italy in the Hague.Enrico Bombieri (1887-1967) |Benito Mussolini |José María Reina Andrade | |- | |Gamalero William Mario | |Ferruccio Parri |Juan José Arévalo | |- | |Aloisi de Laderel, Baron Folco (Comte di Al lumière) |(Born in Paris, on June 2, 1907 married to Maria Aloisi de Larderel. |Fernando Tambroni |Miguel Ydígoras Fuentes | |- | |Giovanni Iannuzzi | |Giovanni Leone |Julio César Méndez Montenegro | |- | | |Emilio Savorgnan |Mariano Rumor |Julio César Méndez Montenegro | |- | |Fabrizio Pediconi |Ambasciatore d'Ita lia a GuatemalaFabrizio Pediconi |Mariano Rumor |Carlos Arana Osorio | |- | | |Joseph Nitti |Giovanni Spadolini |Fernando Romeo Lucas García | |- | | |(*1921)Giuseppe Avitable |Bettino Craxi |Óscar Humberto Mejía Víctores | |- | | | |Bettino Craxi |Vinicio Cerezo | |- | | |Umberto Zamboni di Salerano |Giulio Andreotti |Jorge Serrano Elías | |- | |Alessandro Serafini |(*Apr. 7, 1936 in Rome) Presented Credentials: Oct. 25, 1993 in Manila Alessandro Serafini |Romano Prodi |Álvaro Arzú | |- | | | |Silvio Berlusconi |Alfonso Portillo | |- | |Pio Luigi Teodorani Fabbri Pozzo |Pio Luigi Teodorani Fabbri Pozzo |Silvio Berlusconi |Álvaro Colom Caballeros | |- | |Mainardo Benardelli de Leitenburg |(*18 dicembre 1964 2013), 48 anni, è morto per cause naturali, la scorsa notte.Mainardo Benardelli de Leitenburg |Silvio Berlusconi |Álvaro Colom Caballeros | |- | |Edoardo Pucci |(nato a Prato nel 1972)Edoardo Pucci |Mario Monti |Otto Pérez Molina | |} Ambasciata d'Italia Guatemala == References == Guatemala Italy
title: List of ambassadors of Italy to Guatemala
